title: Dad of 'Moonies' cult family 'arrested for keeping kids in house for nine years'

Police have arrested the father of a family kept in a farmhouse for nearly a decade, reports say.

The 67-year-old was one of six people discovered at the property in Ruinerwold, Drenthe, the Netherlands.

Officers found the victims used a 'fantasy language' and were no longer able to speak after spending nine years in isolation, it is claimed.

Earlier this week police arrested a man, known as 'Josef B', for allegedly imprisoning the family, who reportedly slept and ate on the floor of their windowless prison.

(Image: Vincent Jannink/EPA-EFE/REX)

(Image: Facebook)



New reports state that both the family and 'Josef B' were part of the Unification Church, commonly known as the Moonies.

The cult was founded in the 1950s by the South Korean preacher Sun Myung Moon, who believed he was the Messiah.

The first suspect was charged on Thursday with unlawful detention and harming others' health, and will remain in detention for at least two more weeks, prosecutors said.

He is 58-years-old and the formal renter of the property, who was reportedly a neighbour of the family at a previous home.

(Image: Wilbert Bijzitter/EPA-EFE/REX)

(Image: Getty)

The second man to be arrested is allegedly the father of the family, The Guardian reports.

Drenthe police said: "Today we arrested a second suspect in the Ruinerwold investigation.

"The arrested person, a 67-year-old man from Ruinerwold, is one of the six persons discovered this Monday in the house located at Buitenhuizenweg (the road where the farmhouse is located)."

Police found the family after the father's eldest son Jan Zon van Dorsten drank five beers in a nearby bar and revealed his ordeal to the owner, it is claimed.

Some of the younger family members were reportedly convinced they were the only humans on earth.
description: Police have arrested the father of the family allegedly locked in a home for nine years in Ruinerwold, Drenthe, reports say
